creator: ansoni@gmail.com
text:
When generating reports for JMeter, it is often useful to have a log of what JMeter Version was used when trying to understand why results may have changed.  

The known way to obtain the version is to use a BSF Sampler and do JMeterUtils.getJMeterVersion().  This is a rather large amount of work for what is a fairly straight forward need.

A _version function or version property would be very nice.
Note that the JMeter version is written to the jmeter.log file, along with the Java versions.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text: Indeed, but the Java Version Information is at least a System Property which begs the question why the JMeter Properties don't include the JMeter Version:-)
creator: ansoni@gmail.com

text:
It would certainly be possible to preset a JMeter property with the version.

This could then be retrieved using the __P() function, which would save creating a new function.
